# Draft:Perlak–Srivijaya War

* Decline of the Shia influence over the coast of Peureulak
* Reunification of Peureulak Sultanate
| combatant1        =  Srivijaya
| combatant2        =
*Peureulak Sultanate
**Baroh (Shi'ite faction)
**Tunong (Sunni faction)
| commander1        = Cudamani WarmadewaMaravijayottunggavarman
| commander2        = Maulana Mahmud ShahMalik Ibrahim Shah Johan
| date              = 986–1006 CE
| casualties2       = Heavy
| casualties1       = Unknown
| territory         = status quo ante bellum
}}
Perlak–Srivijaya war or also known as Perlak–Srivijayan conflict was a series of war in Sumatra between Srivijaya and Peureulak Sultanate. The war inflicted by the Srivijayan ambition to conquer Peureulak after seeing their wealthier trade. The war ended by the reunification of Peureulak under Sunni influence with economic and trade consequences
